channel.title: Colors change each time you login
channel.description:
As tossed by Benland100 and confirmed by me:
[center][size=16pt][b]MINIMAP COLORS CHANGE EACH TIME YOU LOGIN!!![/b][/size][/center]
not good.

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

Pyro:

Galook its just like one shade darker or lighter.

yes, i researched it a little while later and found out that the tolerance IS the euclidian distance between the two points(c1 and c2 are Colors):

tolerance = sqrt( (c2.r-c1.r)*(c2.r-c1.r) + (c2.g-c1.g)*(c2.g-c1.g) + (c2.b-c1.b)*(c2.b-c1.b));

it is faster to take out the square root and just square the tolerance you are looking for for comparisons though

edit: this is what I thought it was but was never sure. BTW, whate are jagex’s banning rules that they follow? if we auto on 1 account and NEVER converse with another account(not even have them added) will only the autoing account get banned? I want to know because I do play legit, but autoing is like a hobby of mine, so I want to do that too.

edit2: i mean do they ip ban?

Read full topic
item.source: Colors change each time you login

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

tolerance is just a different shade of the same color, you won’t be able to see the difference in tolerance with your eyes until it starts getting up past 40-50, i cant really give you a example of tolerance its just something you need to learn about on your on…

Also after testing a script modifyed with 10 tolerance it may get greater then 10 when switching chars as my script stopd working after 5 or 6 chars had logged in so i belive the Tolerance at Loading Screens is around 5-10 and the Tolerance on Switching Chars is 10-40? More testing needs to be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:19, topic:2982”][quote author=Galook link=topic=3369.msg33505#msg33505 date=1147995104]
by tolerance do you mean distance between the two colors in the color sphere? or is it something else?
[/quote]

I can’t explain to well… But it’s basically just that it’ll be “tolerant” around other similar colors. It’ll recongnise that the color’s are almost the same and click on that color anyways.

At least that’s what I think it is.[/quote]

Yeah, I was thinking that. So, how much is 1 tolerance?

I mean can you give me an example of 2 colors that are 10 telerance and 20 tolerance apart?

Read full topic

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“Dankness, post:16, topic:2982”] Iv been expermenting with this since yesterday and after walking from lumby-> fally and recording each color change at the loading screens 20 times, then logging out and in 20 more times and recording the color changes, iv determined this

–> Road Color changes within 0-10 Tolerance Range
–> WaterColor does not change on Loading screens, or Logouts i guess it would on World thou
–> BankColor was same a WaterColor

To test this thoery simply Load RS, Pick the roadcolor then Logout or Walk then Check the roadcolor, kepe doing this til your bored then simply compare it in SCAR with SimilarColors to see what you have… or just run this script with the data enterd…

[php]
program ToleranceCheckerbyDankness;

const CE = 2; // ** Set to How Many Colors you Have
var Colors : Array [ 1…CE ] of Integer;
var A, C : integer;

procedure SetUpColors;
begin
Colors[1] := 0;
Colors[2] := 0;
end;

begin
for C := 1 to CE do
repeat
A:=A+1;
until (SimilarColors(Colors[1],Colors[C],A))
Writeln ( 'Tolerance for Color 1 -> Color ‘+IntToStr ( C ) +’ := '+ IntToStr ( A ));
end.
[/php][/quote]

I have also been doing some testing…

Here is what I have found out:(Only about 80% checked over…)

The first time I log in in a world, it is one coloru [/u] After passing a single loading screen it changes to color2u [/u] At the next login screen it may change to color3, but sometimes it just stays the same. After a logout, it will either be color3, or color2, but after the first loading screen it always changes back to color2.

Agin, I have only been testing this for about half an hour, so do not quote me on anything here.

Edit: I think I am completely wrong after some more testing, anyway, here is what I got Dankness: Tolerance for Color 1 -> Color 3 := 2

Read full topic

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

Iv been expermenting with this since yesterday and after walking from lumby-> fally and recording each color change at the loading screens 20 times, then logging out and in 20 more times and recording the color changes, iv determined this

–> Road Color changes within 0-10 Tolerance Range
–> WaterColor does not change on Loading screens, or Logouts i guess it would on World thou
–> BankColor was same a WaterColor

To test this thoery simply Load RS, Pick the roadcolor then Logout or Walk then Check the roadcolor, kepe doing this til your bored then simply compare it in SCAR with SimilarColors to see what you have… or just run this script with the data enterd…

[php]
program ToleranceCheckerbyDankness;

const CE = 2; // ** Set to How Many Colors you Have
var Colors : Array [ 1…CE ] of Integer;
var A, C : integer;

procedure SetUpColors;
begin
Colors[1] := 0;
Colors[2] := 0;
end;

begin
for C := 1 to CE do
repeat
A:=A+1;
until (SimilarColors(Colors[1],Colors[C],A))
Writeln ( 'Tolerance for Color 1 -> Color ‘+IntToStr ( C ) +’ := '+ IntToStr ( A ));
end.
[/php]

item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

I just run some tests. I now think the colors only change the first time you log out and in on the same world. Please confirm.[br][size=1]Posted at: May 17, 2006, 12:39:23 pm[/size][hr]tested and discovered that it’s even worse.

[center]MiniMap Colors rotate each …loading please wait… screen. [/center]

We wont be able to make proper walkers anymore. SCAR is dead.

Read full topic

item.source: Colors change each time you login

item.title: Colors change each time you login
item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

no. on the same world you … on the same world!!! :eek:

Sorry to shout earlier, but this is really the death blow to SCAR and SRL right now. It means we cant rely anymore on simple colorfinding once at startup of our script. Once we log out and log in with our next Player, we will need to do sometimes complicated colorfinding routines again, and those are not always 100% depending on the object we need.

Read full topic
